hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Cointegration Breakout Pairs Trade
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations from its 90-day mean, a mean-reverting pairs trade will generate positive returns within 5 trading days when executed in neutral or bullish regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH exhibit strong long-term correlation (0.85+ 90-day rolling) but experience temporary decoupling during news events or sector rotation. The 90-day mean captures the evolving relationship while 20-day z-score identifies extreme deviations. Neutral/bull regimes provide sufficient liquidity and reduce tail risk of permanent divergence.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH price ratio 20-day z-score > +2.0: Short BTC, Long ETH (equal dollar notional)
BTC/ETH price ratio 20-day z-score < -2.0: Long BTC, Short ETH (equal dollar notional)
Regime confidence > 50% for NEUTRAL or BULL
Trade only entered between 10:00-11:00 UTC to avoid overnight gaps
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of trades result in losses OR average win/loss ratio < 1.2 over 100+ backtested instances across 2023-2024.
